intro: Hosackia nudata, commonly known as the nakedleaf false indigo, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It produces showy blue to purple flowers in late spring to early summer. Hosackia nudata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, providing food for pollinators.
